H0.text: what kind of government does iran have after 1979. Islamic Republic

H1.text: what kind of government does iran have after 1979. Authoritarian Regime

H2.text: what kind of government does iran have after 1979. Constitutional Monarchy

H3.text: what kind of government does iran have after 1979. Theocracy

A4.text: Iran is an Islamic theocracy governed by elected and unelected institutions, with ultimate authority vested in the supreme leader.

A5.text: The Iranian government is authoritarian and has been widely criticized for its poor human rights record, including restrictions on freedom of assembly, expression, and the press, as well as its treatment of women, ethnic minorities, and political dissidents.

A6.text: The Islamic Republic of Iran was created shortly after the Islamic Revolution.

A7.text: The Supreme Leader of Iran is the country's head of state and commander-in-chief of the armed forces.
